body:
@alexbrainman  I think you meant Pascal's enumerated set.
That's best implemented with bitsets, not Go's maps.

With the help from iota (1<<iota), the bitset implementations
in Go are quite straightforward to write and use.

And for larger (dense) sets, we could use math/big.Int, and
for sparse integer sets, we have
https://godoc.org/golang.org/x/tools/container/intsets
